caption: Possibly the best beef in the Chicagoland area.
It's the best Beef in Chicago I wish I could give more stars the service was great and speedy
Best Italian beefs in Chicago with consistently great service
A Chicago icon!
Awesome beef sandwiches.....tasty treat.
Beef sandwiches how they're supposed to be. Thank you.
The best italian beef in chicago
Always good food, service and prices!!
Cash only place but have atm that don’t work lol place is a joke it’s year 2021
Great food
Best beef in Chicagoland.  Special trip, detour to Mr. Beef.  Now it's a "favorite" in my GoogleMaps
Excellent beef sandwiches

We've been hunting down the best Italian Beef sandwich in Chicago. Customer service was awesome. Prices are very reasonable especially for downtown. They have their own parking lot. The fries are cut on the premises. Fricking delicious! The beef was tender and piled high!
Owned by aristocrats who hail beef, Keith Richards visits when the Stones come thru town, fabulous food and service!👏
Old school place I've been going here for years love it
Everyone needs to try there beef sandwich its amazing way better than Al's beef.
Well I said first time here n the guy did not care I asked for what I wanted he offered nothing as far as add on So yeah not a good experience
Only take cash. Good food and reasonable prices!
(Translated by Google) Here is the best Italian Beef Sandwich in Chicago!  (Original) Aqui tienen el mejor Italian Beef Sandwich de Chicago!
I love their beef sandwiches and  I have a crush on the big black guy that works there. He's so handsome and friendly.
Best Italian beef and combos in town.
The food is great and I love the guy that works there. Ernest❤
The greatest beef sandwich in the universe

Best authentic Italian beef sandwich in Chicago. Free parking in lot next door -in River North which alone is incredible as well as ample street parking. Large dining room, fast, courteous service. Forget the chains and eat at a Chicago institution
Good Italian beef

This was my son’s first introduction to Italian beef’s, about 10 years ago. We have been coming back ever cents. John, often times would open up the video game machine and give my son free games to play. Ivan, would have a great conversation with him. An awesome guy and restauranteur.  We returned this past Sunday, after not being there for about a year. Walked in and was hoping to see John, but he was not there. Two other gentlemen were there, and took my order. I looked and saw the one gentleman grab the beef barehanded, and break it apart with the bare hand into whatever it was sitting on top of the flat top Grill. No gloves  on. I then saw him count money, put it back into the register, then grab the bread and open it up with the same hands. He put the beef into the bread using bare hands also,And then dumped his bare hand and the sandwich into the juice. I can only imagine what was getting washed off his hand into that use throughout the day. I am a restaurant manager, and I was standing there blown away. It had been a long day, I didn’t want to call him out right there, so I just grabbed my sandwiches and left.  I don’t think I’ve ever been as grossed out at a restaurant. John, I hope you read these, and get this place back up to standards.
THE BEST ITALIAN BEEF IN THE STATE! PERIOD!!!!
Best beef in Chicago.
Second favorite Beef in Chicago. Johnny’s on North Ave just has something extra. However if you’re an out of towner and don’t want the trek, this will do ya goooood m durrrtyyy
It's mr. Beef c'mon juicy and hot!!

Mr. Beef is not only one of my favorite Chicago restaurants, it’s one of my favorite places to eat in the world!  And I eat a lot. Promise.  Usually I get the Italian beef sandwich, “hot n wet”, local slang for spicy and dipped in jus. The giardiniera w slices of celery is great. The spot is open late on weekends I think, and this is a must have when visiting this great city. I’ve tried three other establishments in Chicago, and one out of state, and Mr. Beef on Orleans is still my go to by far. Will miss it when I return back home to Cali!  One cool thing was on a Sat night the owner was letting a homeless guy take a breather inside. It was freezing w ice and snow on the ground outside. I think a lot of people can die in weather like that. Great to see humans being bros!
Combination sandwich, wet, with hot peppers is quite possibly my favorite sandwich in the world.
Get it dipped
This is di best... Try a combo
The beef was bland but the fries was great
One of my goals i had when visiting from Detroit  was to get an authentic Italian beef...dipped with giardiniera. This place was just what the doctor ordered.
I used to have lunch there when I lived up the street in atrium village.  I had to stop in whenever I'm in town. Great food and atmosphere.
Me. Beef on Orleans is a classic! It's been there for decades and the simple selection is on point. I've never had anything than an excellent experience.
Beef was great, messy and delicious. Frys were good however fill the damn bag. I ordered frys with my beef and bag was barely half full.
Pretty dam good. Try it..

This to me is the BEST Beef. I have eating here 1000 plus times. In Chicago, we debate who has the best Italian Beef, but I say Mr. Beef on Orleans. Order the Italian Beef...EXTRA Beef on on sandwich. Add HOT Peppers AND a few Very little sweet peppers (very few sweet peppers with a much higher ratio of hot peppers). Then tell them to make it a little extra WET. You want it dipped once and a bit extra..you don't want it dry and not too wet. That is how to get a great BEEF Mr. BEEF is always Great!! It is where the professional Chicago eaters EAT!!!

Came here the other night after a day & night of drinking, this place had one of the best italian beef sandwich and fries. the beef was super good and moist and the au jus was just perfect, I'm pretty sure they make there own giardiniera which wasn't the hottest but very good, this place is a must
A native Chicagoan’s pick!  Get a combo juicy and hot!  You’ll want one for the trip home...
Food is decent, staff are hilarious but why no bathroom?
The best combo with sweet peppers in Chicago.
Crazy delicious Italian beef sandwiches! Get the hot AND sweet peppers.
Went and visited Machine Shop in Chicago and the gentleman who owns the Machine Shop took me here and introduced me to the Italian beef sandwich amazing Chicago good food
Beefs was good but honestly wasn't even warm. Also wasn't a fan of not being able to wash my hands before I left. Some wet naps would be nice.
It just doesn't get any better than wet, hot and sweet with a tamale on the side. Mr. Beef rules!
Sandwich was incredible but it gave me the runs. Cook probably didn’t wash his hands after taking a dump smh
Beer was good, the fries sucked.
Fresh beef, cool vibes, mortal kombat 😊
Great food and service
Great as always

Great tender beef and it's homemade giardiniera peppers! The portion of the beef is phenomenal, just crazy generous, I was full by the 5th bite but of course as long as there are peppers left I will not stop eating it because the peppers with the diced celery is YUMMY, giardiniera peppers at it's best, nowhere else can I get this unless I make it myself- it's that good!
Good food, fast service, friendly staff.
Good food but als beef beat them hand down

I was in Chicago with some friends and I wanted to have the best Chicago Steak Sandwich so we went to this place because of his reputation. It sucks. The sandwich was ok but the place is terrible. Not even a bathroom to was your hands: just a bucket with water! I would not recommend it.
The best beef in Chicago, possibly anywhere.
Friendly staff that made me feel like family for the afternoon. Delicious sub and chicken sandwich. They ended our meal by topping our visit off with amazing fries and cannolis. Thanks Joe!

Went there Friday night to get my normal Italian beef no dip with hot peppers it’s normally a great sandwich. While eating I’m saying to myself it taste different, but it’s late and I was hungry so I still ate it. Bad decision! Woke up the next day with food poison I will not be goin there to eat ever again
My husband insisted we stop here after the Chicago Bears Family Fest. Best beef sandwich around and in ChiTown, that's saying something!
I hadn't been there in decades and it was better than I thought
This the best places to eat long time ago this guys was used scala sausage is the #1 right fred scala make sausage on the new location at Villa Park
Beef was not what I expected. Jus tasted watered down and the beef was so wet that the bread was falling off and made it hard to eat.
Italian Beef sweet and spicy dipped with hot oil sooooo good. Wish I would have taken one back to the STL 🔥

Overall the beef just wasnt good. I've lived in Chicago my entire life and I've drove by Mr. Beefs on Orleans a multitude of times and finally wanted to try it; big mistake. The meat was tough, the juice was nasty and the peppers didnt suffice either. Worst beef I've had in awhile especially for the Chicago downtown price. I feel sorry for tourist who partake in this place who want to try Italian beefs from Chicago, especially if it's their 1st time. If you want an good authentic Italian beef try Scatchells on Cermak, Al's beef on ontario, the Patio on Taylor st. or Mr. Beef and Pizza on Harlem. You're welcome

In from out of town and wanting to try a beef sandwich.  We Foolishly  passed up Al's just thinking "let's not settle on the first beef spot we see." Well almost 40 minutes later we're arrived at Mr.Beef, The cook wasn't happy to see my family and I come in. we were  promptly served and knew erhardt we washed- dripping beef sandwich the chicago way, fries, and a Pepsi. The fries weren't fresh and the beef sandwich makes me wish I could hit  rewind- definitely not a life changing experience here.
10 years later and it’s still the best Italian beef in Chicago
Good beef. Hot peppers had a ton of celery, but was good.
Good beef. Fries are ok. Having a parking lot is convenient. Friendly staff. CASH ONLY. NO BATHROOMS.
Not 1979 prices. Still worth it!
Tasty and fast. Real authentic place, if you want a good Italian beef sammy go here.
Ask for extra service and the Afro American with a nasty disposition. I am Afro American as well. I will never go there again.
Terrific as always
Good beef

It's the best. The best quality beed. I like to get beef whenever I'm in Chicago and it's a must I go to mr beef. I love the chew to the bread and the hot and sweet peppers. Also get a cannoli. They are the freshest cannolis I have ever had
Idk who paid for all these good reviews but it’s ok nothing special about it .. the cashiers a dik I don’t get how ppl keep going in there
The Italian beef dip is delicious
Great beef, ask for extra peppers.
The best BEEF!

Incredible sandwich (Combo.) Delicious beef and sausage cooked ready to order with a pairing of home made sweet and spicy pepper. Hold the phone. The handcut fries, were cooked to perfection. I'm talking crisp, I'm talking crackle, I'm talking an expletive laced debacle. Stop settling for average, you deserve a meal at Mr. Beef!
If you like the same person handling money and preparing your food with no gloves it's 👍..

Its a hole- in- the wall lunch spot. Food is fine for something quick, but the big dude at the register is rude as hell. He stands outside and is uninviting... you all trying to make money? If so, be more hospitable. A simple thank you goes along way in life.

While driving by, after dropping my daughter off at Union Station, on a Friday, I saw a sign in the window for pepper and egg sandwich $4.00. Because it was Lent, I decided to stop in and order one. The sandwich was "killer". Peppers mixed with carefully scrambled eggs on a French roll slightly dipped in beef juice. Delicious! After eating it, I had to order the Italian beef because I heard they are one of the best in the city. I ordered it with sweet peppers and giardinaire on the side. I asked the counter man to wrap it with extra paper because I would not eat this until the next day. Next day, put it in microwave and nuked it for 1 minute. Even with it being a day old, it was the best beef I ever had, and I've had them all. From Johnnie's in Elmwood Park, Mr. Beef on Harlem, Bobo's on Irving Park, Luke's on Harlem, Jays in Harwood Heights and many others. my previous favorite was Mr. Beef on Harlem which is another great sandwich,
If you don't know about this place, you're not from Chicago. Best place in the Chi...
The best Italian beef sandwich around hands down all the food is good outstanding rib eye steak sandwiches
Best Italian beef in the city.
Omg the best canolis ever 🤗
Stopped in for a cup of coffee and some French fries while killing some time between appointments. No frills. Decent food. They had a large dining area but no bath room to use which was a bummer!

We are beef aficionados.  My first time having Mr. Beef today as i was in the neighborhood doing business.  My usual beef spot is in Elmwood Park which we frequent weekly.  Yes...you know the one.  But always wanted to try Mr. Beef.  Got 6 beefs dipped with hot peppers.  A bit more pricey than others but still reasonable to me. Fast service..lots of thank yous..to the beefs..DELicious.  Milder than I expected but flavorful tender meat.  Will definitely get it again.  Quiet and easy in and out on a Tues afternoon.
Best beef in the city!!! There is no Finder beef in the city
Sorry guys...not what it use to be
Good sandwiches but I wish their were more veggies. The Italian sandwich was my favorite. If you love a ton of meat on bread this is your place.

I was let down I live hours away. Not as great as they used to be. love Mr. Beef been going to this location since mid 70's. Tonight my wife and son went in and spent over $50.00 on 3 beers with sweet peppers, 3 pops, 3 fries and 3 cannoli. The problem was the older guy the owner made and served our beefs. The amount of meat on the hard roll was very small. He was also yelling and cursing at a black guy that works there that made us all feel bad.
Mr Beef is the best in the city! I’ve had them all and there is no comparison. I don’t know who I like more, Chris, Lauren or Joe!

I would like to share my experience at this location ! First of all , I have heard about this place from Chicago’s Best on YouTube , they advertised  this place as being a nice and historic Restaurant and they are doing very good Italian Beef. I said , let’s try .... I order an Italian beef , those guys who works there they don’t know nothing about sanitation... It’s a very dirty place. I asked for restroom and they said that,  they don’t have a public one , but hey can let me use their personal  restroom, which  is in  the back of the kitchen... I appreciate that they let me use their restroom in the back of the kitchen but , when I’e seen how dirty is in the back , and one guy was smoking in the kitchen  I was shocked ... The beef is just ok, not the best not the worst in Chicago .... In my opinion Portilos on Ontario str. and Clark street are doing better Italian Beef and they are much cleaner place !
Heaven sent !!!!
Best Beefs Ever👌
Still a good beef sandwich. Very expensive. Go to portillo or Al's a few blocks away just as good and cheaper.

This is a Chicago institution and possibly the best Italian beef I've ever eaten, and I've had more than my fair share.  The fries compliment this as well.  It's also very affordable, but is cash only.  My only gripe, I wish they had a sink to wash hands.  They have wet towelettes, but this sandwich is too juicy for that.  This is a must stop every time I'm in Chicago, no question, and I usually take a pound or two of beef back with me when I leave.
The hot dogs with fries are freakin delicious!!! Totally recommend!
Best Italian beef sandwich in the world!
Great food Great service
Still one of one of the best beef sandwiches in Chicago
Good food in an unpretentious setting.
The absolute best beef sandwich in the world. I can't remember a time that I didn't eat here. I'm disappointed email I order anywhere else.
Food! Italian beef combo dipped! DO IT!!
A fun very basic place to get great Italian beef sandwich. Don’t expect white linen and fine silverware.
Very good
Nothing beats a combo beef and sausage at Mr Beef

Great food. The place kind of takes you back in time. I loved seeing the pictures of stars that have eaten and helped out. Lots of old pictures too. The owner even had pictures of him as a child up. He was very friendly.
Best beef in town! Maybe I'll try something else next time... But why mess with what's so good?

Just visited Chicago for the very first time. Spent around 5 hours walking around downtown and the only pictures that I took were of the hot beef I had here. Amazing food, amazing staff. I will be back.
A favorite no frills beef sandwich. Nothing fancy just one of the best beefs in Chicago
Best Italian Beef in Chicago! Mr Beef yessss!
so good. we ate our way through chicago & had a chance to compare multiple italian beefs. this was the best by far. get it hot & wet.
The beef was ok
Not as good as it used to be...expensive & sub par....
It reminds me of the tasty talion beef so I grew up with. The staff was unbelievably wonderful.
Great flavors. Amazing and speedy service. Great staff. Amazing and worth every minute it takes to find it
Nice place to grab a quick bite and the Italian beefs are 👍👍

Outrageously good Italian beef sandwich. Authentic food, authentic people. A great place for a late night snack on the weekend. (They have shorter hours on the weekdays.) Be careful. It can get messy.
The best in Chicago at times, but not every time. Pretty good even at their worst. Great fries.

The fries at this place are the best I’ve EVER had. They had the right amount of crispy, and salt. The Italian beef I got was super yummy as well. If you’re in Chicago and looking for real Chicago food this is the place to go!

I know it’s 1am and they have open until 4am but for an chicken sandwich for what I paid $8 I deserve the chicken to be fresh!! The taste of the chicken was disgusting, cooked long time ago and warmed at the microwave, no salt! The fries same thing cooked long time ago, they was looking so dry!!! Never ever in my life I will not gonna come back at this place, and definitely I will not recommend!
Such a great beef sandwich at a reasonable price!
Mmmm... Delicious tender Italian beef!!
Very good, short of great. Not as good as it's been in the past.

I have been going to this Mr. Beef's since the mid-80's and I think that their Italian Beef and sausage combo sandwiches are the best anywhere.  I always get them with hot peppers and have it dipped in the juice.  They are messy but SOOO good.  I am hungry just thinking about them.
Best Italian beef in Chicago  - and that's saying something!!
Super rude staff

It's all good but that fat guy in the morning at the first register for some reason always put my lunch money in his pocket and I know that's not his store and he likes to be disrespectful the owner needs to keep his eye on him.
We love this place. We come from San Antonio Texas and always eat here!!!
Too expensive for normal burgers/italian beef.
Mr. Beef is nice, awesome, and runs a beef counter.  If you are a tourist and looking for a Chicago beef sandwich, come to this place!
Hotdog was nothing special. Served on mushy bun. Fries served were mostly bits and pieces about less than an inch length. Still they were greasy and tasty which is what I prefer.
Yo, at the moment I haven't sampled the food yet? But they getting 5 stars just because they got a photo of Christopher walker from king of new York on they're wall. Mad love.

Saw this place on best chicago! Then i rememberd as a child over 30 years ago i went here wit my fam. Got so exited to go bak. Went today. Never again will i go here .beef is so undercooked taste like rubber. I asked for sweet pepper on my beef they put 1 sweet pepper wow g wizz. !! I asked for fries and the bag in wich the fries came in was so big! But they counted the fries all of my familys fries were the same only around 20 fries in each bag .!! The bag was not even half full. Payed soooo much money for 20 fries come on! Realy horrible cheap place cant believe its still open!! People must b nuts.

I love Italian beef sandwiches and ever since I moved to Texas, it's a ritual to get one every time I visit Chicago.  On this Christmas vacation, my dad convinced me to try Mr. Beef instead of Portillos or Al's.  Walking in was a blast from the past. Pictures of famous people at Mr. Beef covered the walls. Jay Leno was all over the place. You would think he worked there!  Parking can be challenging but at least we didn't have to wait in line. A nice guy with a strong Jersey/New York (sorry, I don't know the difference) accent welcomed us. We ordered Italian beef dipped with hot and sweet peppers and fries. While we waited, we browsed around the pictures in the seating area and had some fun. The food was ready pretty quickly and we sat down to eat it.  The Italian beef was one of the best I've had. It was hot, juicy, and packed with LOADS of flavor. The meat was shaved perfectly and surprisingly, it didn't have a bunch of fat pieces. That's a bonus for me. I haven't had celery in an Italian beef sandwich before and I really liked the crunchiness it added. Make sure to get a ton of napkins because it ain't a pretty thing. Juice will get everywhere. It's incredible. I couldn't tell if there was a bathroom, so I just cleaned up as best I could with napkins. You will definitely need to wash your hands though because they will smell like Italian beef. Overall, a 5 star Italian beef sandwich.  The fries were also really freaking good and I am so picky with fries. They have to be served hot, crunchy on the outside, soft in the inside, and nicely salted. Mr. Beef did it right!  I wish I knew the name of the guy who was working because he was so welcoming and made us feel very comfortable.  Maybe the few bad reviews explain why this location was near empty, but all I can say is that we had a really good experience when we went for dinner.  I need another trip to Chicago just for this.
NOT THE BEST,  definitely great food but their is better beefs in the suburbs.
Very good beef sandwich with a nice atmosphere
Great Italian Beef when drunk :-) Good hot dogs as well !
Nice "juicy" beef sandwich

You know damn well you have the worst beef in Chicago walk down the street to Als Beef and come visit me I work here let me show you what a real beef taste like with 19 spices in it and super thinly sliced
So yummy!  Now I know what all the talk is about. I wish I lived closer. This is a must stop when you are in Chicago.
This is my Go-To spot if I am downtown and looking for massive protein intake. It is no frills beef spot with a back dining room full of communal seating. Decent price for a good sammy.
Love da place!!!! The guys in there are great. If you have a complain't about the food you ain't from around here. Its,all awesome so go back to where you came from. Mr Beef rocks!!!!!
Good hot beef.I would comeback and recommend to.anyone who wants a tasty,juicy  beef  sandwich.

I was just in there and the guy with the bandana, maybe italian or hispanic man was so fast and so thorough. I couldnt believe it, I almost wanted to hug him because I was so hungry. He took care of lile 7 people in 5.minitez, does math in his head like crazy...idk who you are but they need to give u a big raise! way to go.
Service is great!
good beef good flavor staff so so
just order a bbq sandwich and it was nasty, dry, over cooked...guy at the counter was so rude too, first and last time I will go there...gross!
No nonsense Italian beef sandwich! I order it with both kind of peppers. Fries are fresh and crispy! Love it!
The hot dogs suck. I guess the beef is better.
great beef & cheese fries
Definitely the  Chicago experience

Decent food, rude service.  Went on a Friday night, the place was dead but apparently they didn't feel like working since they told me "cash only" - ignoring the fact they have stickers for all major credit cards directly on their window.  Don't want my money - cool...I'll go to Al's for better food.
Great food and nice service. The Italian beef sandwich was awesome! Thanks for the experience!
The best of the best.
Always my first stop in the City.  Amazing beef.

Food may be good but the service is not. I went in and found the workers incredible rude. They took my order, processed my card, and gave me my food. I stood there for a good two minutes waiting for anything else I need to do like sign the receipt. They then proceeded to take the next persons order. So I walked away and got yelled at for needing to sign the receipt.  Maybe that day was stressful but if that's the norm, I won't be going back.
Food is standard greasy spoon fare. Staff is rude. The late night crowd is the only reason this place stays open.
Quick, reasonable, and good
Good food. Relatively expensive compared to competition.
Tried the italian beef and so far the best I've had in Chicago, the cashier was awesome excellent customer service. Thanks!
Love this place.
Down to earth joint. Solid food. And dessert, too! Services are quick. About four stools and a long standing ledge for dining in.

(Translated by Google) Amazing Italian juices, juicy, with a lot of flavor, well priced and with a large dining room.  (Original) Unos Italian Beef increíbles, jugosos, con mucho sabor, bien de precio y con un comedor amplio.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would ! I ordered the hot and mild beef sandwich and the hit dog (Chicago style) and received air in place of it . That's what it tasted like AIR! . Paid 25$ for some cotton picking air !  I almost shed tears the food was so bad I sat there starring at my sandwich in hopes it would somehow acquire flavor .. If you like seasoning and flavor Do not go there .

The perfect Combo. Perfectly seasoned and sliced beef, not too thin, not too thick. Perfect gravy, good for the dunking. Perfect Sausage. Perfect giardiniera. The best, absolute best. Joey Mantegna agrees, so there. Can't get more Chicago than that guy....sup he lives in LA now.
My second favorite Italian Beef sandwich in Chicago.
Everything is good
Best beef in town.
Best beef samdwich EVER !!!

There is a reason this is a Chicago institution. It's great all the time. It's not fancy, it just does beef right. The combination with hot peppers is the best anywhere. The BBQ sandwich on a hamburger bun is a special treat when they have it. There is a back room with one large very long community table to eat at.
Best beef in Chicago
Finally made it here no big Deal!  I've had much better beef sandwiches!
Good food fast service good portions
Beef sandwich tasted very plain. Almost no flavor, just watered down beef.
Absolutely delicious !
Best Italian combo in all Chicagoland
Best Italian beef sandwhich I've ever had. Hands down.
The best! Wish I could have one now!
On par with Als beef. Must try before dying
The here burgers are amazing!
The food is ok. Mr. Beefs on Harlem is a hundred times better.. there employees are very ignorant and rude!.. you will never see me giving my money back to that shady business
This place is great. They are a better option over Al's beef and cheaper. They make a better beef sandwich and their sauce is tastier.
Great beef omg

So was carving some Italian beef and walked by this unassuming establishment hoping to get a decent sandwich. My hopes were underated. One of the best beef sandwiches I've had in Chicago and the service was on point.  First the beef sandwich was drenched in juice, huge portions of meat, and quality outstanding. The workers were friendly, informative, and fast.  Next time your over in river north you must stop by give this place a try.  Oh and definitely get a chocolate macadamia nut shake.  Props guys.
Food was great
The beef from here is amazing the taste is like no other
Best italian beef sandwich I ever tasted!
Good food.
The best beef sandwich ANYWHERE!
Beef was a little too fatty for me. Fries were good
Best beef in the city! Trust me, get it spicy and wet...you won't regret it!

Hands down the best Italian beef shop in town. It's no fuss, no frills, no gimmicks with Mr. Beef. The meat is always hot and the french fries are delicious. Don't forget to bring cash and order two sandwiches, you'll want both.

Best Italian beef sandwich I ever had. Giardenera is home made,  and the the juice is a family recipe and makes the sandwich. Perfect! Jay Leno swears by them and always has a bunch when he comes to Chicago.

As much as I have seen great reviews from famous chiefs to top reaturants I can not express how disappointed I am. A dipped italian beef sandwich is GREAT when made proper. Tasted like they dipped it in water no flavor. Beef taste than Subways beef sub. I've traveled from Detroit which honestly has better italian beef sandwichs from gas station sandwich shops. Beef is juicy and dip has great beef flavor. What a shame. Love the Chicago hot dog although LA has great dogs too. Detroits chili dog is a close second. Save your money try somewhere else. I praised Al's before I tried it. I couldn't wait to comment how Chicago has the great pizzas, great hot dogs, And we'll don't try the Italian Beef sandwichs. 1 city can't be great at everything...

For Italian in Chicago this is THE place. I have been eating at this place for decades. The dipping juice is salty and flavorful, the beef is thin and plentiful. The place is a little bit of a dump and the workers is old school Chicago rough, but who cares, you come here for the beef. Shut up and enjoy the sandwich. BTW, you can smell them cooking up the beef in the morning you will want it for breakfast too.

Wanted Italian beef, got great Italian beef. Looking forward to trying more of the menu, but the Italian beef sandwich hit the spot. Get the sandwich wet with got and sweet peppers. Plus the staff is very friendly and willing to answer questions if it's your first run.  Enjoy!
Guy that took our order was extremely rude. Big fat black guy. He can't hear the orders righr so he barks at customers. He's costing the owners money. Stick with Al's beef.
I think they have the best Italian beef! fries are really good too
My favorite Italian beef in the city. Sadly not my favorite giardinera though.
It's the best!
Delicious sandwich.  AMAZING fries. Don't expect a smile from the staff tho...!

I went on a late night Friday and they were giving people different prices, just randomly throwing numbers at costumers assuming that they're drunk and won't realize, I looked at the menu and asked for a receipt, and it was 5 dollars less than what I paid. Other than that food is good for a late night bite
Hands down the best! Fresh ingredients, amazingly friendly staff and such a cozy homegrown environment. The Italian beef combo is to die for.
Literally the best Italian Beef Combo in the world.

I wouldn't even call it an Italian beef. This is a glorified road beef sandwich. Bread was OK. Sandwich was dry. Sweet peppers were undercooked. Giardeniera barely had any taste. Above all the meat had no seasoning. Worst Italian beef in Chicago (I tried 12 of them).

I've lived in Chicago for much of my life, and I've worked my way through the various beef stands as my stomach allows. Mr. Beef's is, in my opinion, the only 5-star beef or combo sandwich. This is no frozen and thawed product. It tastes cooked on site, sliced, and seasoned with artistic care. Maybe I'm wrong, but that's what it tastes like. Their "sweet and hot" pepper mix is unique, which scared me at first, but is just plain awesome. The bun holds up to a full load without becoming mush (unlike Al's). The amount of beef is enough for a hearty appetite, and the Italian sausage part of the combo is also fresh tasting and high end. The price is less than Al's or Portillo's; however, the lack of an on-site bathroom is a distraction. Don't be concerned with the gruff employees; they know you'll love it, and they focus on the product. I can talk about other menu items, but that would defeat the purpose: this is simply the best beef sandwich that Chicago has to offer (until I'm proven wrong!).

If you like Italian beef, this place is worth a visit. Not the best beef in the greater Chicago area, but pretty tasty and man does the place have a lot of character.  Good fries and cannoli too. I was even given the cannoli on the house after making two orders (beef, then sausage), a nice touch.
It's a great place, with awesome staff. I love going there every time I visit the family. Very filling, and (of course) tasty.
The Italian Beef dipped is soooooo good, Omg.... pass the ciagrette!!
Awesome Italian Beef!

So my buddy had me come here as he raved about it. To me it was just OK. Definitely a hole in the wall place. I hated how the guys did not use gloves to make the food. Seemed pretty unsanitary. The fries were good but the Italian beef sandwich I ordered was missing something and I can't put my finger on what it was... oh it was missing flavor.

Hey I'm slaughtering my diet today, so why not try Mr Beef?  Beefs are a topic every Chicagoan has an opinion about. Ultimately it comes down to a personal choice. Mr. Beef will never be on my short list of the cities best beefs. It's just okay. Al's on Taylor (the original, not the other locations) is hands down better.
I don't care who eats here, or why people seem to comment so heavily regarding jay leno, but it's a decent sandwich if you're not into making your own.

Beef by the pound Beef by the pound...  One of the best Italian Beef spots in the city.  If you looking for a good Italian beef that simple, this is the spot.  Run in and grab you one and fries and you are set to go.  Beef is always juicy, sweet or hot peppers and the bread is delicious.  And if you really like it, you can order their Italian beef by the pound to take home with you.  I've done it before and they give you well enough beef and juice to almost recreate it at home.

Top 3 beefs I've ever had in my life. Stepping into Mr. Beef is like stepping into a piece of  Chicago history. Pictures of celebrities fill the walls for a reason. Bring cash and make sure to sit down in the Elegant dinning room attached.

I use to be a fan. My parents always took me here.  I thought that this was the holy grail of beef.  Then my wife dragged me to Al's, she never liked Mr Beef. And I realized I did not like this place anymore. The staff is not friendly. You would think that after all these years I would feel like a regular. I had many good years but I've grown up.
Reasonable prices, friendly and welcoming staff, delicious sandwiches and freshly cooked fries. An absolute delight, and a definite place to visit.
I don't usually eat combos but when I do IT'S ONLY AT MR. BEEF! Hands down best beef sandwiches in Chicago! Others pale in comparison. The fries are excellent as well!

Be prepared to bring your big boy pants because these sandwhiches are BEEFY! Whether you are a beef enthusist, or just a tourist that lost his way, you have to stop by. You might even run into Ron Swanson chowin down.
Best late night Italian Beef spot on the planet.
Best Italain beef in the city of chicago!!!!!!!!!

My wife and I went the other day, and I'm not sure I'll ever go back. The Italian Beef isn't bad, there are just other places that are better. My biggest complaint is the giardiniera. It's not very spicy and it mostly celery, which in some bites was the dominant flavor. Subway has better giardiniera for crying out loud.
Mr. Beef is Mr. Good.
Good Beef
If you live in Chicago or are visiting Mr. Beef is a must. Made famous by the famous consider yourself famous for going to Mr. Beef. Enough Said!
Best late night food after a night out. They do attract a crowd during the day, too. Love the french fries and the BBQ sauce.

Hot Italian beef & cheese fries...what more do you want late-night? This location holds a special place in my heart because my fiance used to live right by here & on the night we got engaged...we took my parents here late-night & they loved it!  Tip: They have weird hours...like open early in the morning, late-night but not in the evening...if that even makes sense!
There is no place like this for product quality and affordability.  The sandwiches melt in your mouth and have a non-tomato based gravy that is out of this world.
Not Bad - maybe a tad better than Al's?
Al's is better.. I don't get how this was ever a debate.
awesome!
Great juicy italian beef sandwiches!
